newsitem.title: USA: Wall Street stocks off lows, techs gain.
newsitem.headline: Wall Street stocks off lows, techs gain.

text.p: Wall Street were weak in afternoon trading on Monday, but eased off session lows as money managers bought stock before the quarter's close.
The Dow Jones Industrial Average, which reeled after the release of stronger-than-forecast manufacturing and home sales data, moved off lows to trade off about 10 points at 7678.
Nasdaq was much firmer, up nearly three points at 1441.
"There has been some end-of-quarter window dressing, particularly in the tech names," said Peter Coolidge, senior equity trader at Brean Murray & Co, said.
The long bond was down 25/32 at a 6.81 percent yield.
